footer.description: Ateba Ombala Marc Foundation - promoting criminal justice, human dignity, social reintegration.

hero.title: Excellence training for improving the judicial system in Africa
hero.subtitle: LAFAOM-MAO Institute
hero.description: The LAFAOM-MAO Institute of Ziguinchor, member of the inter-African LAFAOM-MAO network, trains Judicial Life Assistants (JLA) to support people affected by judicial decisions.
hero.mission: Our mission is to make justice more human and effective by reducing the devastating impacts on women, children and the elderly, victims of social and health vulnerabilities.
hero.institute: WE ARE THE LAFAOM-MAO TRAINING INSTITUTE.

technicalAssistant.title: Judicial Life Assistant specialty: Technical Assistant
technicalAssistant.description1: Acting in the judicial environment cannot be reduced to interventions on the person directly or indirectly affected by a judicial decision: someone must also ensure that teams have the financial means to carry out their interventions. A key role, at the heart of action, even if it's not always visible!
technicalAssistant.description2: This is where the Technical Assistant specialist comes in: a true conductor behind the scenes, ensuring that funds are available and budgets are well used. More than just a manager, the Technical Assistant is a field person who knows the teams, challenges and stakes of interventions. Without him, nothing would work as well!
technicalAssistant.mission1: Building the sponsor network - He or she ensures that each ward has a solidarity network that will pool resources for the implementation of the individualized intervention plan.
technicalAssistant.mission2: Making the sponsor network viable - He or she ensures that the IT system that activates the individual Mao-X solidarity network is available, accessible and reliable.
technicalAssistant.mission3: Accountability - He or she ensures that communication between the solidarity network and intervention teams takes place through permanent issuance and dissemination of financial management documents and their archiving.

judicialSupport.title: Judicial Life Assistant specialty: Judicial Services Support
judicialSupport.description1: The penitentiary is a public service, as such it is part of a global public policy that includes interactions with other services. Someone must also maintain this balance so that the detained person integrates into the normal functioning of society. This ensures a state of mind conducive to correction and especially reintegration. A key role, at the heart of action, even if it's not always visible!
judicialSupport.description2: This is where the Judicial Services Support specialist comes in, a true conductor of the 'citizenship' of the person directly or indirectly affected by a judicial decision. More than just a negotiator, the Judicial Services Support specialist is a field person who knows how institutions work.
judicialSupport.mission1: Building the judicial services network - He or she ensures that each ward enjoys their rights through a network of judicial services for the implementation of the individualized intervention plan.
judicialSupport.mission2: Access to the judicial services network - He or she ensures that the network enjoys accessibility and verifies availability.
judicialSupport.mission3: Bypassing - He or she ensures that the bypass mechanisms provided by the Mao Program work and perfectly play its temporary substitution role.
judicialSupport.trainingTitle: With the LAFAOM-MAO Institute, become a judicial life assistant specialty: Judicial Services Support
judicialSupport.trainingDescription: In its premises based in Ziguinchor, Senegal, the LAFAOM-MAO Institute offers a 12-month training program to train for the Judicial Life Assistant profession specialty Judicial Services Support. Regardless of age, educational level and professional experience, the knowledge dispensed is individualized and allows acquiring the necessary competence.
judicialSupport.pathTitle: The training path for the Judicial Services Support specialty
judicialSupport.phase1: Integration phase (2 months) - I chose during the two-month integration phase at the Training Center a masterpiece related to one of the Judicial Services Support missions.
judicialSupport.phase2: Masterpiece - At the end of the two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a masterpiece.
judicialSupport.phase3: Collective project - At the end of the two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a collective project.
judicialSupport.phase4: Individualized intervention plan (4 months) - At the end of your integration period you are integrated into a team for the collective project you intervene in the aspect of your masterpiece in collaboration with other colleagues who have chosen masterpieces in other Judicial Services Support missions; all within a complete individualized intervention plan for 4 months.
judicialSupport.phase5: Humanitarian mission (3 months) - At the end of conducting the Masterpiece and the collective project, we integrate for three months an associative project in favor of detainees in integration practice in a partner association.
judicialSupport.note1: The first month of training is that of developing tools and administrative procedures to obtain all necessary accreditations for training in favor of the learner.
judicialSupport.note2: During the knowledge determination stage, the pedagogical team will carefully study your background (level and field of training, nature, duration and level of responsibility of your professional experiences...), and to propose theoretical content adapted to the required skills.

welcomeSupport.title: Judicial Life Assistant specialty: Welcome, listening and support
welcomeSupport.description1: The penitentiary is a living environment, the being who finds himself there keeps his sociality intact. He retains all the social ties that must be renewed and maintained at the level closest to where they were before detention. Someone must ensure this state of mind conducive to correction and especially reintegration. A key role, at the heart of action, even if it's not always visible!
welcomeSupport.description2: This is where the Welcome, listening and support specialist comes in, a true conductor of the detainee's sociality. More than just a psycho-sociologist, the Welcome, listening and support specialist is a field person who knows social interactions.
welcomeSupport.mission1: Restructuring Sociality - He or she ensures that each ward has all the social ties provided by the implementation of the individualized intervention plan.
welcomeSupport.mission2: Sociality fluidity - He or she ensures that all social ties function at least with the fluidity before detention.
welcomeSupport.mission3: Restoration and substitution - He or she ensures that social ties broken by prison or by crises affecting couples can be restored or substituted during the detention period or crisis.
welcomeSupport.trainingTitle: With the LAFAOM-MAO Institute, become a judicial life assistant: Welcome, listening and support
welcomeSupport.trainingDescription: In its premises based in Ziguinchor, Senegal, the LAFAOM-MAO Institute offers a 12-month training program to train for the Judicial Life Assistant profession specialty Welcome, listening and support. Regardless of age, educational level and professional experience, the knowledge dispensed is individualized and allows acquiring the necessary competence.
welcomeSupport.pathTitle: The training path for the Welcome, listening and support specialty
welcomeSupport.phase1: Integration phase (2 months) - I chose during the two-month integration phase at the Training Center a masterpiece related to one of the Welcome, listening and support missions.
welcomeSupport.phase2: Masterpiece - At the end of the two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a masterpiece.
welcomeSupport.phase3: Collective project - At the end of your two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a collective project.
welcomeSupport.phase4: Individualized intervention plan (4 months) - At the end of your integration period you are integrated into a team for the collective project you intervene in the aspect of your masterpiece in collaboration with other colleagues who have chosen masterpieces in other Welcome, listening and support missions; all within a complete individualized intervention plan for 4 months.
welcomeSupport.phase5: Humanitarian mission (3 months) - At the end of conducting the Masterpiece and the collective project, we integrate for three months an associative project in favor of detainees in integration practice in a partner association.
welcomeSupport.note1: The first month of training is that of developing tools and administrative procedures to obtain all necessary accreditations for training in favor of the learner.
welcomeSupport.note2: During the knowledge determination stage, the pedagogical team will carefully study your background (level and field of training, nature, duration and level of responsibility of your professional experiences...), and to propose theoretical content adapted to the required skills.

coordinator.title: Message from the MAO Program Coordinator
coordinator.intro: LAFAOM-MAO organizations, including the LAFAOM-MAO Institute of Ziguinchor in Senegal, belong to the inter-African LAFAOM-MAO network established by the MAO Program of the LAFAOM Association. This is a program aimed at supporting people directly or indirectly affected by judicial decisions.
coordinator.study: A study conducted from 2020 to 2023 in the judicial system in Africa established that, like arterial hypertension for the human body, judicial decisions are silent killers. They have consequences:

women.title: For women
women.item1: Double domestic-carceral assignment: Reconciling domestic roles and incarceration constraints.
women.item2: Conjugal solidarity under criminal constraint: Support for incarcerated spouse despite legal pressures.
women.item3: Penitentiary sexual perversions: Sexual abuse targeting female detainees.
women.item4: Sexual abuse under judicial authority: Exploitation by authority figures in the judicial system.

children.title: For children
children.item2: Incarceration of a parent/guardian: Disruption of family supervision.
children.item3: Parental separation: Emotional and social instability.

elderly.title: For the elderly
elderly.item1: Deprivation of filial support: Loss of help from incarcerated children.
elderly.item2: Parental vulnerability: Increased fragility due to absence of descendants.
elderly.item3: Socio-affective weaning: Emotional isolation due to incarceration of loved ones.

human.title: For human beings
human.item1: Health vulnerability: Increased health risks in detention.
human.item2: Social vulnerability: Exclusion and stigmatization related to incarceration.

coordinator.conclusion: In absolute terms, the number of victims of judicial decisions in Africa is higher than that of natural disasters or wars. The judicial system is inappropriate to the social model. Over the past two years, it has been about convincing funders, based on the 'nexus' approach, that this is a situation that falls under the humanitarian sector. This is a crisis to be classified among permanent humanitarian emergencies. The greatest success has been to get them to accept that intervention in this sector required specific know-how and know-how. That of social work professionals we have called: Judicial Life Assistants (JLA).
coordinator.institute: With the Academy Inspectors of the Ministry of National Education of Senegal, we were able to establish, in Ziguinchor, the LAFAOM-MAO Training Institute specialized in the 12-month training of Judicial Life Assistants. A training based on the Mao pedagogical system.
coordinator.quote: Being a Judicial Life Assistant means implementing individualized intervention plans for different wards to reduce the devastating effects of judicial decisions. It is about making justice more human and, therefore, more effective.
coordinator.final: At the LAFAOM-MAO Training Institute, we know that to help a person in a vulnerable situation, it is important that the Judicial Life Assistant has a respectable academic background. However, the pedagogical principles implemented allow us to adapt all academic levels to the desired operability. This is a challenge we have set ourselves.

activities.title: recent activities
activities.noNews: No news available at the moment.

testimonials.testimonial1: JLA training has assets that can provide all the necessary skills to effectively support people facing difficulties related to judicial decisions.
testimonials.testimonial2: The Mao Program and the LAFAOM-MAO Training Institute train competent professionals who make a difference in judicial support.An original inter-African network
testimonials.testimonial3: Thanks to my experience in Justice-Prison social action services, I can say that in principle, professionally supporting people affected by judicial decisions is a meaningful mission.

slide1.title: Join the LAFAOM-MAO Institute in Ziguinchor
slide1.description: Train to become a Prison-Justice professional and join an African network committed to justice and humanitarian work.

slide2.title: Mao Program: A network for justice
slide2.description: Contribute to improving criminal justice and supporting people affected by judicial decisions across Africa.

slide3.title: Become a Life Assistant in the Judicial Universe
slide3.description: 12-month training in three specialties: Technical Assistance, Support for Penitentiary Services, and Welcome, Listening, Support.

section4.title: Message from the coordinator
section4.desire1: Anyone wishing to pursue a career in social services, as a judicial life assistant in the LAFAOM network and elsewhere;
section4.desire2: To update their knowledge in the field of social work for personal or professional development.
section4.personalizedTraining: Personalized training for 63 learners per promotion, from all countries in the world, adapting to their individual background and experience over a period of 12 months distributed as follows:
section4.nineMonths: 9 months of support at the Center where learners benefit from pedagogical supervision in terms of support in the realization of:
section4.threeMonths: 3 months of practice for the integration of masterpieces and collective projects into a global associative project, in a professional environment, in partner associations specialized in the Justice-prison field, with more than ten years of experience in Europe where the support of detained persons is already a custom.
section4.certificate: Certificate of Aptitude for the Function of Judicial Life Assistant
section4.specialty1: Welcome, listening and support for affected persons;
section4.specialty2: Support for penitentiary insertion and probation services;
section4.certificateIssued: The certificate is issued by the Ministry of National Education of Senegal at a level equivalent to the basic diploma plus two years.
section4.LAFAOMDescription: "LAFAOM" is a 1990-type association, declared on April 10, 2019 following Receipt No. 00000304/RDA/J06/A2/SAAJP/BAPP.
section4.objective1: Create a synergy of action between the different professional bodies of the association members;
section4.objective2: Promote respect for human rights in the administration of justice;
section4.objective3: Constitute a research pool and a Documentation Center for Law and Legal Sciences.
section4.specialtiesPresentation: The different specialties of Judicial Life Assistants

technician.title: I - Technical Assistant
technician.trainerQuote: Message from the specialty reference trainer:
technician.quote: Having the specialty of Technical Assistant in the profession of judicial life assistant, is to provide direct support to teams implementing individualized intervention plans by ensuring the availability of funds and their management. It guarantees the financial balance of the intervention while respecting management procedures. This position is essential for good intervention!
technician.professionTitle: The profession of judicial life assistant specializing in Technical Assistant:
technician.description1: Acting in the judicial environment cannot be reduced to interventions on the person directly or indirectly affected by a judicial decision: someone must also ensure that teams have the financial means to carry out their interventions. A key role, at the heart of action, even if it's not always visible!
technician.description2: This is where the Technical Assistant specialist comes in: a true conductor behind the scenes, ensuring that funds are available and budgets are well used. More than just a manager, the Technical Assistant is a field person who knows the teams, challenges and stakes of interventions. Without him, nothing would work as well!
technician.mission1: Building the sponsor network: He or she ensures that each ward has a solidarity network that will pool resources for the implementation of the individualized intervention plan.
technician.mission2: Making the sponsor network viable: He or she ensures that the IT system that activates the individual Mao-X solidarity network is available, accessible and reliable.
technician.mission3: Accountability: He or she ensures that communication between the solidarity network and intervention teams takes place through permanent issuance and dissemination of financial management documents and their archiving.
technician.trainingTitle: With the LAFAOM-MAO Institute, become a judicial life assistant specialty: Technical Assistant:
technician.trainingDescription: In its premises based in Ziguinchor, Senegal, the LAFAOM-MAO Institute offers a 12-month training program to train for the Judicial Life Assistant profession specialty Technical Assistant. Regardless of age, educational level and professional experience, the knowledge dispensed is individualized and allows acquiring the necessary competence.
technician.pathTitle: The training path for the Technical Assistant specialty:
technician.phase1: I chose during the two-month integration phase at the Training Center a masterpiece related to one of the Technical Assistant missions.
technician.phase2: At the end of the two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a masterpiece.
technician.phase3: At the end of the two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a collective project.
technician.phase4: At the end of your integration period you are integrated into a team for the collective project you intervene in the aspect of your masterpiece in collaboration with other colleagues who have chosen masterpieces in other technical assistance missions; all within a complete individualized intervention plan for 4 months.
technician.phase5: + 3 months of humanitarian mission: At the end of conducting the Masterpiece and the collective project we integrate for three months an associative project in favor of detainees in integration practice in a partner association.
technician.note1: The first month of training is that of developing tools and administrative procedures to obtain all necessary accreditations for training in favor of the learner.
technician.note2: During the knowledge determination stage, the pedagogical team will carefully study your background (level and field of training, nature, duration and level of responsibility of your professional experiences...), and to propose theoretical content adapted to the required skills.

penitentiarySupport.title: II - Support for penitentiary services
penitentiarySupport.trainerQuote: Message from the specialty reference trainer:
penitentiarySupport.quote: Having the specialty of Support for penitentiary insertion and probation services in the profession of judicial life assistant, is to facilitate access to penitentiary insertion and probation services for the detained person and all persons affected by detention. It is about giving them geographical, intellectual, cultural and financial accessibility on the one hand and ensuring transit availability on the other hand. It is an actor that allows the detained person and affected persons to continue to enjoy citizenship rights that are not alienated by the sentence, during detention. This position is essential for good intervention!
penitentiarySupport.professionTitle: The profession of Judicial Life Assistant specializing in Support for penitentiary services:
penitentiarySupport.description1: The penitentiary is a public service, as such it is part of a global public policy that includes interactions with other services. Someone must also maintain this balance so that the detained person integrates into the normal functioning of society. This ensures a state of mind conducive to correction and especially reintegration. A key role, at the heart of action, even if it's not always visible!
penitentiarySupport.description2: This is where the specialist in Support for penitentiary insertion and probation services comes in, a true conductor of the 'citizenship' of the detained person. More than just a negotiator, the specialist in Support for penitentiary insertion and probation services is a field person who knows how institutions work.
penitentiarySupport.mission1: Building the penitentiary services network: He or she ensures that each ward enjoys their rights through a network of penitentiary services for the implementation of the individualized intervention plan.
penitentiarySupport.mission2: Access to the penitentiary services network: He or she ensures that the network enjoys accessibility and verifies availability.
penitentiarySupport.mission3: Building a palliative network: He or she ensures that the bypass mechanisms provided by the Mao Program work and perfectly play their temporary substitution role.
penitentiarySupport.trainingTitle: With the LAFAOM-MAO Institute, become a judicial life assistant specialty: Support for penitentiary services:
penitentiarySupport.trainingDescription: In its premises based in Ziguinchor, Senegal, the LAFAOM-MAO Institute offers a 12-month training program to train for the Judicial Life Assistant profession specialty Support for penitentiary services. Regardless of age, educational level and professional experience, the knowledge dispensed is individualized and allows acquiring the necessary competence.
penitentiarySupport.pathTitle: The training path for the Support for penitentiary services specialty:
penitentiarySupport.phase1: I chose during the two-month integration phase at the Training Center a masterpiece related to one of the Support for penitentiary services missions.
penitentiarySupport.phase2: At the end of the two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a masterpiece.
penitentiarySupport.phase3: At the end of the two-month integration period in a penitentiary establishment you choose a collective project.

penitentiarySupport.phase5: + 3 months of humanitarian mission: At the end of conducting the Masterpiece and the collective project we integrate for three months an associative project in favor of detainees in integration practice in a partner association.
penitentiarySupport.note1: The first month of training is that of developing tools and administrative procedures to obtain all necessary accreditations for training in favor of the learner.
penitentiarySupport.note2: During the knowledge determination stage, the pedagogical team will carefully study your background (level and field of training, nature, duration and level of responsibility of your professional experiences...), and to propose theoretical content adapted to the required skills.

welcomeSupport.title: III - Welcome, listening and support
welcomeSupport.trainerQuote: Message from the specialty reference trainer:
welcomeSupport.quote: Having the specialty Welcome, listening and support, in the profession of judicial life assistant, is to facilitate the conduct of daily life activities for the detained person and all persons affected by detention. It is about maintaining at the pre-detention level the balance between the ward and their social environment. This comes down to three possibilities of action, one on the ward, another on the social environment and a last one on the interaction between the two. It is an actor that allows the ward to preserve their sociality during detention. This position is essential for good intervention.
welcomeSupport.professionTitle: The profession of Judicial Life Assistant specializing in Welcome, listening and support:
welcomeSupport.description1: The penitentiary is a living environment, the being who finds himself there keeps his sociality intact. He retains all the social ties that must be renewed and maintained at the level closest to where they were before detention. Someone must ensure this state of mind conducive to correction and especially reintegration. A key role, at the heart of action, even if it's not always visible!
welcomeSupport.description2: This is where the specialist in Welcome, listening and support comes in, a true conductor of the detainee's sociality. More than just a psycho-sociologist, the specialist in Welcome, listening and support is a field person who knows social interactions.
welcomeSupport.mission1: Restructuring sociality: He or she ensures that each ward has all the social ties provided by the implementation of the individualized intervention plan.
welcomeSupport.mission2: Sociality fluidity: He or she ensures that all social ties function at least with the fluidity before detention.
welcomeSupport.mission3: Restoration and substitution: He or she ensures that social ties broken by prison can be restored or substituted during the detention period.
welcomeSupport.trainingTitle: With the LAFAOM-MAO Institute, become a judicial life assistant: Welcome, listening and support:
welcomeSupport.trainingDescription: In its premises based in Ziguinchor, Senegal, the LAFAOM-MAO Institute offers a 12-month training program to train for the Judicial Life Assistant profession specialty Welcome, listening and support. Regardless of age, educational level and professional experience, the knowledge dispensed is individualized and allows acquiring the necessary competence.

keyDates.description1: The pedagogical team will meet to prepare the launch of educational activities, including the implementation of training programs and the coordination of pedagogical resources.
keyDates.description2: Learners will officially begin their training at the Institute for Training Judicial Life Assistants, marking the start of the academic cycle.
keyDates.description3: Closure of the training program, with final evaluation of learners and validation of achievements.
keyDates.description4: An official ceremony will be organized for the presentation of diplomas to learners who have successfully completed their training.
keyDates.description5: Graduates will be directed to professional positions within the Institute's activities, promoting their integration into the judicial environment.

budgetDiscussion.title: Budgeting
budgetDiscussion.description: The discussion on the Institute's budget has been postponed to November 19, 2025.

boardMeeting.title: Board of Directors
boardMeeting.description: The Board of Directors, meeting during its session from October 9 to 11, 2025 in Bremen, Germany, meticulously defined and validated a precise calendar to frame the organization and conduct of activities of the LAFAOM-MAO Training Institute. This calendar, the result of in-depth deliberations, aims to structure the key stages of the training cycle for judicial life assistants, while ensuring rigorous planning for learners, the pedagogical team and stakeholders. The following dates have been set to ensure the proper functioning of the Institute's educational and administrative programs, in alignment with the strategic objectives of the Ateba Ombala Marc Foundation:

howToApply.title: How to apply for a job?
howToApply.description: The application process for our job offers is simple and transparent. Follow this step-by-step guide to successfully submit your application.

step1.title: Step 1: Access the Recruitment page
step1.description: Visit our website and click on the "Recruitment" menu in the main navigation.
step1.item1: Click on "Recruitment" in the navigation menu
step1.item2: You will be redirected to the page of available job offers

step2.title: Step 2: Explore available job offers
step2.description: Browse the list of job offers and review the details of each position.
step2.item1: Review detailed descriptions of each position

step3.title: Step 3: Select a job offer
step3.description: Click on the "(+)" button at the right end of the job offer to see the job offer details, then "Apply" for the job offer of your choice.
step3.item2: Check that you meet the employment conditions
step3.item3: Note the required skills and experience

step4.title: Step 4: Fill out the application form
step4.description: Complete the online form with your personal and professional information.
step4.item1: Personal information: Name, first name, email, phone, address

step5.title: Step 5: Upload required documents
step5.description: Attach the documents necessary for your application in PDF format.
step5.item6: Any document required by the job offer (PDF format, max 10MB)

step6.title: Step 6: Submit your application
step6.description: Review all information, then click on "Apply directly".

step7.title: Step 7: Payment of application fees
step7.description: You will be redirected to the payment page to pay the application fees.
step7.onlinePayment: Online payment method: you will be redirected to the payment page to pay the application fees.
step7.bankTransfer: Bank transfer payment method: In addition to presenting the documents, you will need to present a payment receipt for your application to be validated.
step7.item4: Verify that all documents are uploaded

step8.title: Step 8: Confirmation and follow-up
step8.description: You will receive a confirmation email with the details of your application.
step8.item3: Information about the next steps in the recruitment process

step9.title: Step 9: Selection process
step9.description: Our HR team will review your application and contact you if you are selected.
step9.item1: Pre-selection: Initial evaluation of your file
step9.item2: Tests and assessments: Technical and psychological tests if required
step9.item3: HR interview: First interview with human resources
step9.item4: Technical interview: Interview with the line manager
step9.item5: Final interview: Last interview with management
step9.item6: Final decision: Notification of hiring decision

prepareDocuments.item7: Any document required by the job offer

prepareInterviews.title: Prepare for interviews
prepareInterviews.description: If you are called for an interview, prepare in advance.
prepareInterviews.item2: Prepare concrete examples of your achievements
prepareInterviews.item4: Be authentic and show your motivation
prepareInterviews.item5: Ask relevant questions about the position and team

checkEmail.title: Check your email

cta.description: Join our community of learners and develop your professional skills
cta.title: Ready to start your training?

trainingProcess.subtitle: Discover how to join our training programs
trainingProcess.title: Training recruitment process

processTraining.title: Detailed guide to the process for applying to training
processTraining.subtitle: Discover step by step how to submit your application to join our specialized training programs.

howToApply.title: How to apply for training?
howToApply.description: The application process for our training is simple and transparent. Follow this step-by-step guide to successfully submit your application.

step1.title: Step 1: Access the Training page
step1.description: Visit our website and click on the "Institute admission process" menu in the main navigation.
step1.item1: Click on "Training" then on "Institute admission process" in the navigation menu
step1.item2: You will be redirected to the page of available training

step2.title: Step 2: Explore available training
step2.description: Browse the list of training and use the filters to find the one that matches your needs.
step2.item1: Click on the plus button (+) at the right end of the training to see the training details
step2.item2: Review detailed descriptions of each training

step3.title: Step 3: Select a training
step3.description: Click on "Register" or alternatively on "Select" to be redirected to the application form.

step4.title: Step 4: Fill out the application form
step4.description: Complete the online form with your personal and professional information.
step4.item1: Personal information: Name, first name, email, phone

step5.title: Step 5: Upload required documents
step5.description: Attach the documents necessary for your application in PDF format.
step5.item5: Any document required by the training (PDF format, max 10MB)

step6.title: Step 6: Submit your application
step6.description: Review all information, then click on "Submit application".
step6.item2: Verify that all documents are uploaded

step7.title: Step 7: Payment of application fees
step7.description: You will be redirected to the payment page to pay the application fees.

step8.title: Step 8: Confirmation and follow-up
step8.description: You will receive a confirmation email with the details of your application.
